item.title: Eric add a quote by Nietzsche
item.description: "Convictions are more dangerous foes of truth than lies." -- Nietzsche

item.title: Eric add a quote by Cicero
item.description: "Diseases of the soul are more dangerous and more numerous than those of the body." -- Cicero

item.title: Eric add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Eric add a quote by Arnold Joseph Toynbee
item.description: "It is a paradoxical but profoundly true and important principle of life that the most likely way to reach a goal is to be aiming not at that goal itself but at some more ambitious goal beyond it." -- Arnold Joseph Toynbee

item.title: Eric add a quote by William Hutchison Murray
item.description: "Until one is committed, there is hesitancy, the chance to draw back, always ineffectiveness. Concerning all acts of initiative (and creation), there is one elementary truth that ignorance of which kills countless ideas and splendid plans: that the moment one definitely commits oneself, then Providence moves too. All sorts of things occur to help one that would never otherwise have occurred. A whole stream of events issues from the decision, raising in one's favor all manner of unforeseen incidents and meetings and material assistance, which no man could have dreamed would have come his way. Whatever you can do, or dream you can do, begin it. Boldness has genius, power, and magic in it. Begin it now." -- William Hutchison Murray
